SEARCH
Package account

Class Insurance

java.lang.Object
account.Insurance
public class Insurance extends Object
Insurance class stores and accesses insurance policy information found in the user's account. The class has methods which work hand-in-hand with the Account object it will be attached to, allowing the account to carry out finance related insurance processes. 
 General usage flow:
 - Use Insurance(int) for initialising insurance objects with existing records in InsuranceAccounts.csv
 - OR Insurance(int, String, LocalDate, double, double, Period) for adding a new insurance object 
 - Use payMonthPremium() for paying of monthly premiums 
 - UsedisplayPremiumBilling() to view next due premium dates
File Dependency: InsuranceAccounts.csv (Account-specific insurance policy information)
See Also:
  • invalid reference 
    Bank insurance catalog class for displaying all policies

  • Constructor Details

    • Insurance

      public Insurance(String insuranceType, String policyName, String policyId, double monthlyPremium, double claimBalance, LocalDate startDate, LocalDate endDate)
      Generic class constructor for class private attributes.
      Parameters:
      insuranceType - Type of insurance coverage: Medical/Property/Travel
      policyName - Name of Insurance Policy format: [Type]Policy[Number], e.g. PropertyPolicy02
      policyId - Unique identifier for insurance policy, e.g. PP02
      monthlyPremium - Outstanding monthly insurance premium balance
      claimBalance - Balance that insurance coverage policyholder is able to claim
      startDate - Start date of insurance policy coverage
      endDate - End date of insurance policy coverage

    • Insurance

      public Insurance(int accountId, String policyId, LocalDate startDate, double monthlyPremium, double claimBalance, Period polPeriod)
      Constructor called when adding a new insurance object from Account
      Parameters:
      accountId - Id of account
      policyId - Policy ID, must correspond with existing insurance policy found in InsuranceCatalog
      startDate - LocalDate value of policy starting
      monthlyPremium - premium due each month
      claimBalance - annual claimable amount
      polPeriod - duration of insurance policy, uses Period object

    • Insurance

      public Insurance(int accountID)
      Constructor that gets information for object attributes from the Insurance.csv file. This constructor's object is normally bound to the user account class to carry out insurance policy related actions. Initialises this object's data attributes with those found in the CSV that match the policyId record. Raises an IO Exception if Insurance.csv data file cannot be located and NoSuchElementException when specified record cannot be found.
      Parameters:
      policyId - The unique policy identifier code that matches the Policy ID field in Insurance.csv.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Test bench for Insurance class methods

    • displayPremiumBilling

      public void displayPremiumBilling()
      Displays a list of monthly premiums and their payment dates. Checks for payment in the current billable month period and displays the annual billing start date and current date.

    • payOffPremium

      public void payOffPremium(double amt)
      Deprecated.
      Replaced by payMonthPremium()
      Pays off the input value of outstanding monthly premium balance. Checks if value in amt argument is within monthlyPremium value and reduces monthlyPremium attribute by amt and informs user on completion.
      Parameters:
      amt - amount to deduct from the monthly premium attribute, monthlyPremium
      See Also:
      • payMonthPremium()

    • payMonthPremium

      public double payMonthPremium()
      Pays the policy premium due for the current month. Checks if premium has already been paid for the month before paying. Informs user on next billable month.
      Returns:
      premium amount due for month

    • setPolicyName

      Parameters:

    • setPolicyNo

      public void setPolicyNo(String number)
      Sets the unique identifier for insurance policy, should correspond with policy type and name
      Parameters:
      number - Value should be in format XP0Y. X: Insurance type (M/P/T), Y: Insurance type specific policy number (1/2/3)
